intro: Bakerella clavata var. tsaratanensis, commonly known as the Tsaratanana bakerella, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with yellow petals and prominent stamens. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the rainforests of northeastern Madagascar. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered with fine hairs. This variety is of particular interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and restricted distribution.
